answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.Your symptoms seem to be due to nerve compression and peripheral neuropathy. Have you been tested for B12 deficiency and diabetes?Since all your blood tests have been normal for autoimmune diseases, it also important to look at other neurological causes also like demyelinating diseases of brain. I would suggest you to consult an experienced neurologist. In the meantime you can try physical therapy under a trained instructor and see if it helps you with your symptoms.Take care!

question: Began a few years ago with big toes being numb and then in June 2008 had MRI and neurosurgeon says I have a bulging discs in lower back.  Upper legs ache with an almost burning sensation when I sit and lower leg muscles on right side of bone sore when any pressure applied as are the sides of my feet.  Back leg muscles cramp easily. Feet tingle and have been diagnosed with neuropathy in my feet.  My feet also get burning cold and hard to warm up but not cold to touch. On 900 mg of neurotin per day which helps some.  Orthopedic doctor says he reads the MRI to be a cyst.  Both doctors say my feet tingling is not related to back problem but didn't start until the back problem started.  Received my second epidural injection yesterday with the first not making much difference.  Also have issues with left shoulder being extemely sore to any pressue such as clothing or seat belt.  MRI on cervical spine shows some compression in discs but orthopedic doctor says not enough to cause any nerve compression.  Just looking for any answers or suggestion and could the shoulder be in any way related to what is going on in my spine.  Have had multiple blood tests run and no rhumatoid arthritus, lupus or immune disease showing up.
title: Multiple symptoms
